data.title: Drew Sidora Is Still Living with Ralph Pittman Amid Divorce
data.meta_description: RHOA's Drew Sidora shares an update on her living situation with her estranged husband, Ralph Pittman. Get the details here.
data.text:
Drew Sidora and Ralph Pittman have yet to go their separate ways — at least, when it comes to their living situation.

More than a year after The Real Housewives of Atlanta couple filed for divorce, Drew confirmed she and her estranged husband have continued “living under the same roof.” However, it wasn’t by choice. She touched on the matter during a recent interview with People magazine, saying drawn-out court proceedings were to blame for their co-habitation.

“It’s still not settled,” Drew said about her divorce battle. “I didn’t even know that could happen. I was like, ‘What?’ But yeah — he is living in the basement.

Drew Sidora gets real about cohabitating with her estranged husband

Unsurprisingly, Drew wasn’t pleased with the “crazy” arrangement, suggesting it hindered her ability to fully move forward.

“It’d be much easier if we were able to move on separately,” she continued. “You know, out of sight, out of mind, with your own space and your own energy. But that’s clearly not in the cards. So sharing space has been a double whammy. We’re kind of like, the blueprint for a sh-tshow divorce.”

She continued: “So I’m just learning how this process can go in the worst-case scenario. And I’m taking it literally one day at a time.”

Drew Sidora and Ralph Pittman's Marriage and Family

Drew and Ralph each filed for divorce in February 2023 after eight years of marriage. The two reportedly met in 2013 when Drew was a single mother to her oldest child, Josiah. The exes got engaged in June of 2014 and officially tied the knot a couple of months later.

About a year into their marriage, Drew and Ralph began expanding their family. They welcomed a son named Machai David Pittman in 2015 and a daughter named Aniya Grace Pittman in 2018.

Drew Sidora reveals what led to her and Ralph Pittman's divorce filings

The actress/singer opened up about her divorce during a June 2023 appearance on Watch What Happens Live with Andy Cohen, saying there wasn't one specific moment that led to their split.

“I think it was a culmination of just the years of enduring and enduring,” Drew said. “And as a wife, you know, my parents have been married for 60 years, so I only saw two people who loved each other and constantly fought for their marriage. That’s how I was raised. But I think at a point when it’s public humiliation and dealing with things that are now coming out in front of the camera, it was a breaking point that I reached.”

Host Andy Cohen then asked Drew if Ralph had been “faithful” during their marriage.

“Well, I know that wasn’t the case,” she responded.
